meanings.def: to create a threat, problem, etc. that has to be dealt with
examples: to pose a threat/risk/challenge/danger
the threat posed by terrorism
Obesity poses real risks to health and happiness.
The task poses no special problems.
to pose a hazard/obstacle/barrier
Pollutants in the river pose a real risk to the fish.
the dangers posed by the possession of nuclear weapons
the environmental threat posed by oil spillages

meanings.def: to ask a question, especially one that needs serious thought
examples: The new play poses some challenging questions.

meanings.def: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be painted, drawn or photographed
examples: The delegates posed for a group photograph.
They posed briefly for pictures before driving off.
She was only too delighted to pose for the cameras.
He was persuaded to pose for his portrait.

meanings.def: to pretend to be somebody in order to trick other people
examples: The gang entered the building posing as workmen.

meanings.def: to dress or behave in a way that is intended to impress other people
examples: I saw him out posing in his new sports car.

meanings.def: a particular position in which somebody stands, sits, etc., especially in order to be painted, drawn or photographed
examples: He adopted a relaxed pose for the camera.
He struck a heroic pose, and cried, ‘I will do it!’
I can't hold this pose much longer!

meanings.def: a way of behaving that is not sincere and is intended to impress or trick people
examples: This show of concern is just a pose.
His air of absent-mindedness was no more than a pose concealing a very acute mind.
His pose as an impoverished artist fooled several wealthy patrons.

meanings.def: to hold your body in a particular way to create a particular impression
examples: to strike a dramatic pose
(figurative) He strikes an attitude of bravery and lonely defiance.

idioms.def: to hold your body in a particular way to create a particular impression
examples: to strike a dramatic pose
(figurative) He strikes an attitude of bravery and lonely defiance.
